alert.note: Alert for Orange; Riverside; San Bernardino; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 6:45AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: .Cold front with widespread rain during the commute. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 843 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Orange, Riverside, San Bernardino and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 843 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water and hydroplaning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 645 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain which is heavy at times. This will cause urban highway flooding. Between 0.1 and 0.2 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anaheim, Santa Ana, Riverside, Irvine, San Bernardino, Fontana, Moreno Valley, Huntington Beach, Garden Grove and Oceanside. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Orange; Riverside; San Bernardino; San Diego
